title.narrative: Empowerment and Livelihood Improvement "Nuton Jibon" Project

description.narrative: The revised Project Development Objective is to improve the livelihoods of extreme poor households and to strengthen the community institutions in selected districts.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :General Implementation and Project Management | Description :SDF, not to amend or waive any provision of PIP andManuals without IDA concurrence | Frequency :CONTINUOUS
Finance Agreement :General Implementation and Project Management | Description :SDF, to implement the Human Resource Policy andManual dated May 13, 2010. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS
Finance Agreement :General Implementation and Project Management | Description :SDF, to maintain during the project implementationperiod, qualified auditors. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS
Finance Agreement :General Implementation and Project Management | Description :SDF, to prepare an annual plan and budget forimplementing the project | Frequency :CONTINUOUS
Finance Agreement :General Implementation and Project Management | Description :SDF, to prepare and adopt an Economic ActivityFederation Manual (EAF) | Frequency :CONTINUOUS
Finance Agreement :General Implementation and Project Management | Description :SF, to recruit and retain staff as per the agreedpolicy in the HR Manual | Frequency :CONTINUOUS
Finance Agreement :Land use Acquisition | Description :SDF, to esnure that there would be no involuntary land acquisition |Frequency :CONTINUOUS
Finance Agreement :Monitoring, Learning and Evaluation | Description :SDF, to establish and maintain a village Rating System torecognize and reward well performing villages | Frequency :CONTINUOUS
Finance Agreement :Monitoring, Learning and Evaluation | Description :SDF, to submit quarterly progress Reporst | Frequency:CONTINUOUS
Finance Agreement :Village Grant | Description :SDF, to ensure that subprojects are selected and appraised in accordance with thecriteria and procedures specified in the COM | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

title.narrative: Reps in comm. based decision making & mgt. str. from vul./marg. beneficiaries(%)
Grievances related to delivery of project benefits that are addressed-(number)
Successful proposals for Innovation Pilots awarded under the competitive window
Reps in comm. based decision & mgt. str. from vul./marg. beneficiaries-male
People participating in community based decision making & mgt str. – male
Reps in comm. based decision & mgt. str. from vul./marg. beneficiaries-female
Villages having at least 5 Community Professionals (CPs) identified, trained and offering services
People participating in community based decision making & mgt str. – female
GAAP recommendations implemented and reviewed annually with the community representatives of project villages
Villages (Gram Samiti, SAC and VCO) rated as A or B grades
Staff performance appraisal results (following HR Policy) of staff performing at Grades A and B, annually from Year 2
Grievances registered related to delivery of project benefits addressed (%)
GSs and VCOs of Phase 1 villages federated at Upazila/Cluster level
Business partnerships established through public/private partnerships with communities
Increase in income of targeted households by at least 50 percent against base year
NJG members having mobilized savings and accessed additional source of finance
Targeted Households benefiting from improved community infrastructure or social services sub-projects
Gram Samiti accessing and managing project funds as per agreed rules and service standards as in the COM
Village institutions supported by the Project functioning in a transparent, inclusive and accountable manner
Completed community infrastructure sub-projects being operated and maintained by communities
Direct jobs created through project facilitation (and at least 50 percent of them are sustained at EoP)
Process monitoring recommendations reviewed and implemented/actions taken by SDF Management
